data.title: HRH the Duke of Calabria (1938-2015) and the Royal House of Bourbon-Two Sicilies
data.meta_description:
Some more photos from the beatification:
 Close up of the programme ~  Inside the Cathedral ~  Member of the public with posters ~  The Princess of Venice...
data.text:
Maria Sophie (1841-1925), Queen of the Two Sicilies and her husband, King Francis II of the Two Sicilies, took refuge in the coastal fortress of Gaeta.

They were besieged by Victor Emmanuel II.

Maria Sophie fought tirelessly to keep up the spirits of the defenders.

She received the nickname of Warrior-Queen.

The fortress fell. Francis II and Maria Sophie were exiled to Rome.

​

The duke and duchess of Noto became parents of their 7th child, a daughter named Maria. Wikipedia sets the date of birth at April 21st but Paul Theroff's online Gotha sets the date of birth at March 5th. I have no idea where they get their information from and I am not able to find anything else online.

Two Sicilies

The duke and duchess of Noto became parents of their 7th child, a daughter named Maria. Wikipedia sets the date of birth at April 21st but Paul Theroff's online Gotha sets the date of birth at March 5th. I have no idea where they get their information from and I am not able to find anything else online.

Two Sicilies

All I could find on the Children of TRH The Duke and Duchess of Noto from Wiki and April 21st as the date

Don Jaime de Borbón-Dos Sicilias, Duque de Capua, 26th of June 1993.

Juan de Borbón-Dos Sicilias, 18th of April 2003.

Pablo de Borbón-Dos Sicilias, 26th of June 2004.

Pedro de Borbon-Dos Sicilias, 3rd of January 2007.

Sofía de Borbon-Dos Sicilias, 12th of November 2008.

Blanche de Borbon-Dos Sicilias,7th of April 2011.

Maria de Borbon-Dos Sicilias, 21st of April 2015.

HRH the Duke of Capua's visit to Naples seem to be a great succes these days.

He also visited Caserta. Some photos and an article of the visits from Noblesse & Royautes:

http://www.noblesseetroyautes.com/w...260_656407251127121_7495118397002598474_n.jpg

http://www.noblesseetroyautes.com/w...013_656407361127110_5879534011910975716_n.jpg

http://www.noblesseetroyautes.com/w...702_656412997793213_2472840111871455747_n.jpg

http://www.noblesseetroyautes.com/w...666_656407621127084_4081136333508092442_n.jpg

Le duc de Capoue en visite à Caserte et Naples

Their first Child was born before their wedding .

I saw pictures of the actual Duke of Calabria , he looks not healty and all , his mother Duchess Alice is still alive (97).

He was in a wheelchair recently at an event and looked very frail of late.

No reaction of the Duke of Castro to this visit of the Duke of Capua to Naples?

Does the Duke of Castro often comment on the Duke of Capua's visits and engagements? (I'm not being off by the way, just genuinely curious.)
